Name: Checks if a recovery point expires no earlier than after the specified period
Description: Checks if a recovery point expires no earlier than after the specified period. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the recovery point has a retention point that is less than the required retention period.

Name: Require any AWS CodeBuild project environment to have logging configured
Description: This control checks whether AWS CodeBuild projects environment has at least one logging option enabled.

Name: Checks if AWS AppConfig configuration profiles have tags
Description: Checks if AWS AppConfig configuration profiles have tags. Optionally, you can specify tag keys. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no tags or if the specified tag keys are not present. The rule does not check for tags starting with 'aws:'.

Name: ECS containers should run as non-privileged
Description: This control checks if the privileged parameter in the container definition of Amazon ECS task definitions is set to 'true'. This control fails if this parameter is equal to 'true'.

Name: Disallow changes to Amazon CloudWatch Logs log groups set up by AWS Control Tower
Description: Prevent deletion and modification of retention policy for Amazon CloudWatch Logs log groups set up by AWS Control Tower.

Name: Checks if Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) task definitions have a set memory limit for its container definitions
Description: Checks if Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) task definitions have a set memory limit for its container definitions. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT for a task definition if the ‘memory’ parameter is absent for one container definition.

Name: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to have minor version upgrades configured
Description: This control checks whether automatic minor version upgrades are enabled for an Amazon RDS database instance.

Name: Require any Amazon ECS task definition to specify a user that is not the root
Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) task definitions run as a non-root user within Amazon ECS containers.

Name: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to send error logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs
Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are configured to send error logs to an Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group.

Name: Require an AWS Private CA certificate to have a single domain name
Description: This control checks whether any AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) Private CA certificates have wildcard domain names instead of single domain names.

Name: Require that an AWS KMS customer-managed key (CMK) is configured with key material originating from an external key store (XKS)
Description: This control disallows creation of KMS keys that do not have a key origin of 'EXTERNAL_KEY_STORE'.

Name: S3 buckets should have event notifications enabled
Description: This control checks if S3 Event Notifications are enabled on an S3 bucket. This control fails if S3 Event Notifications are not enabled on a bucket.

Name: Checks if Malware Protection is enabled for an Amazon GuardDuty detector in your account
Description: Checks if Malware Protection is enabled for an Amazon GuardDuty detector in your account. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Malware Protection feature in Amazon GuardDuty is not enabled for your account.

Name: Checks if AWS Site-to-Site VPN connections have Amazon CloudWatch logging enabled for both tunnels
Description: Checks if AWS Site-to-Site VPN connections have Amazon CloudWatch logging enabled for both tunnels. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Site-to-Site VPN connection does not have CloudWatch logging enabled for either or both tunnels.

Name: Require an AWS AppSync GraphQL API cache to have encryption at rest enabled.
Description: This control checks whether an AWS AppSync API cache has encryption at rest enabled.

Name: CodeBuild project environments should have a logging configuration
Description: This control checks whether a CodeBuild project environment has at least one log option enabled.

Name: Classic Load Balancer should span multiple Availability Zones
Description: This control checks whether a Classic Load Balancer has been configured to span multiple Availability Zones. The control fails if the Classic Load Balancer does not span multiple Availability Zones.

Name: Require an Amazon EBS volume configured through an Amazon EC2 launch template to encrypt data at rest
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 launch template with EBS volume block device mappings is configured to enable EBS volume encryption.

Name: Require that the organization's AWS Key Management Service resources are accessible only by IAM principals that belong to the organization, or by an AWS service
Description: This control disallows AWS Key Management Service API operations for your organization's AWS Key Management Service (KMS) resources by an AWS IAM principal, when the principal is outside of the organization and is not an AWS service principal.

Name: Checks if Amazon CloudWatch Log Groups are encrypted with any AWS KMS key or a specified AWS KMS key Id
Description: Checks if Amazon CloudWatch Log Groups are encrypted with any AWS KMS key or a specified AWS KMS key Id. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a CloudWatch Log Group is not encrypted with a KMS key or is encrypted with a KMS key not supplied in the rule parameter.

Name: Enable CloudTrail in all available regions
Description: Track AWS API call activity within your accounts using AWS CloudTrail, which records call history including the identity of the caller and the time of the call.

Name: Checks if a recovery point was created for AWS Storage Gateway volumes
Description: Checks if a recovery point was created for AWS Storage Gateway volumes. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Storage Gateway volume does not have a corresponding recovery point created within the specified time period.

Name: Checks if AWS Network Firewall firewalls have logging enabled
Description: Checks if AWS Network Firewall firewalls have logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a logging type is not configured. You can specify which logging type you want the rule to check.

Name: Detect whether public access to Amazon RDS database instances is enabled
Description: Detect Amazon RDS database instances that allow public access.

Name: Checks if the AWS KMS key policy allows public access
Description: Checks if the AWS KMS key policy allows public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the KMS key policy allows public access to the KMS key.

Name: AWS KMS keys should not be deleted unintentionally
Description: This control checks whether AWS Key Management Service (KMS) customer managed keys (CMK) are scheduled for deletion. The control fails if a KMS CMK is scheduled for deletion.

Name: Require an Elasticsearch domain to encrypt data at rest
Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains have encryption-at-rest enabled.

Name: Checks if an Amazon WorkSpace volume has the user volume encryption settings set to enabled
Description: Checks if an Amazon WorkSpace volume has the user volume encryption settings set to enabled. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the encryption setting is not enabled for the user volume.

Name: Require an Amazon Redshift cluster to have audit logging configured
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster has audit logging activated.

Name: Require an Amazon ElastiCache (Redis OSS) cluster to have automatic minor version upgrades activated
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ElastiCache (Redis OSS) cluster has automatic minor version upgrades enabled.

Name: Require an Amazon EFS volume to have an automated backup plan
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon EFS file system has been configured with automatic backups through AWS Backup.

Name: Disallow changes to AWS Config aggregation set up by Control Tower
Description: Protect the integrity of AWS Config aggregation set up by Control Tower to collect configuration and compliance data.

Name: EFS access points should enforce a user identity
Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) access points are configured to enforce a user identity. This control fails if ‘PosixUser’ is not defined under ‘configuration’ or if parameters are provided and there is no match in the corresponding parameter.

Name: IAM root user access key should not exist
Description: This AWS control checks whether the root user access key is available.

Name: Require encryption on all AWS CodeBuild project artifacts
Description: This control checks whether AWS CodeBuild projects are configured to encrypt artifacts.

Name: Require that an AWS KMS asymmetric key with RSA key material used for encryption has a key length greater than 2048 bits
Description: This control checks whether an AWS KMS asymmetric key with RSA key material, which is used for encryption and decryption, to use a key spec with a key length greater than 2048 bits (that is, a key spec other than 'RSA_2048').

Name: ECR repositories should have at least one lifecycle policy configured
Description: This control checks whether an ECR repository has at least one lifecycle policy configured. This control fails if an ECR repository does not have any lifecycle policies configured.

Name: Detect whether public write access to Amazon S3 buckets is allowed
Description: Secure access to data stored in Amazon S3 buckets by detecting whether public write access is allowed.

Name: Disallow all public sharing of Amazon EBS snapshots
Description: This control blocks the public sharing of your Amazon EBS snapshots by configuring block public access for Amazon EBS snapshot settings at an account level. This setting has the effect of preventing all public sharing of your EBS snapshots, so that snapshots that previously were publicly shared are treated as private, and are no longer publicly available.

Name: Require that Amazon EC2 transit gateways refuse automatic Amazon VPC attachment requests
Description: This control checks whether Amazon EC2 transit gateways are configured to accept Amazon VPC attachment requests automatically.

Name: Amazon Elastic MapReduce cluster master nodes should not have public IP addresses
Description: This control checks whether master nodes on EMR clusters have public IP addresses.

Name: CodeBuild project environment variables should not contain clear text credentials
Description: This AWS control checks whether the project contains environment variables AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY.

Name: Checks if an Amazon Cognito user pool has advanced security enabled
Description: Checks if an Amazon Cognito user pool has advanced security enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if advanced security is not enabled. Optionally, you can specify an advanced security mode for the rule to check.

Name: Checks if automated sensitive data discovery is enabled for Amazon Macie
Description: Checks if automated sensitive data discovery is enabled for Amazon Macie. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if automated sensitive data discovery is disabled. The rule is APPLICABLE for administrator accounts and NOT_APPLICABLE for member accounts.

Name: Enable AWS Config in all available regions
Description: Identify configuration changes to AWS resources using AWS Config.

Name: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to have a VPC configuration
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS database (DB) instance is deployed in a VPC (that is, an EC2 VPC instance).

Name: Require an Amazon ECS container to run as non-privileged
Description: This control checks whether container definitions in Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) task definitions are configured with elevated privileges.

Name: Checks if an AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) endpoint for Amazon Neptune databases is configured with IAM authorization
Description: Checks if an AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) endpoint for Amazon Neptune databases is configured with IAM authorization. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an AWS DMS endpoint where Neptune is the target has IamAuthEnabled set to false.

Name: S3 bucket server access logging should be enabled
Description: This control checks if an Amazon S3 Bucket has server access logging enabled to a chosen target bucket.

Name: Require any AWS Network Firewall firewall policy to have an associated rule group
Description: This control checks whether there is at least one stateful or stateless rule group associated with an AWS Network Firewall firewall policy.

Name: Checks whether IAM groups have at least one IAM user
Description: Checks whether IAM groups have at least one IAM user.

Name: Require an Amazon CloudWatch log group to be encrypted at rest with an AWS KMS key
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudWatch log group is encrypted at rest with an AWS KMS key

Name: Require an Amazon RDS DB parameter group to require Transport Layer Security (TLS) connections for supported engine types
Description: This control checks whether an RDS DB parameter group requires Transport Layer Security (TLS) connections, for supported engine types.

Name: Checks if AWS Shield Advanced is enabled in your AWS account and this subscription is set to automatically renew
Description: Checks if AWS Shield Advanced is enabled in your AWS account and this subscription is set to automatically renew. The rule is COMPLIANT if Shield Advanced is enabled and auto renew is enabled.

Name: Detect whether Amazon EBS optimization is enabled for Amazon EC2 instances
Description: Detect whether Amazon EBS optimization is enabled for your Amazon EC2 instances that can be optimized for EBS.

Name: Require an AWS Lambda function to be in a customer-managed Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
Description: This control checks whether an AWS Lambda function has been configured with access to resources in a customer-managed Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

Name: Checks if Amazon Redshift clusters are logging audits to a specific bucket
Description: Checks if Amazon Redshift clusters are logging audits to a specific bucket. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if audit logging is not enabled for a Redshift cluster or if the 'bucketNames' parameter is provided but the audit logging destination does not match.

Name: RDS cluster snapshots and database snapshots should be encrypted at rest
Description: This control checks whether Amazon RDS cluster snapshots and database snapshots are encrypted.

Name: Stopped EC2 instances should be removed after a specified time period
Description: This control checks whether any EC2 instances have been stopped for more than the allowed number of days. An EC2 instance fails this check if it is stopped for longer than the maximum allowed time period, which by default is 30 days.

Name: Checks that the access granted by the Amazon S3 bucket is restricted to any of the AWS principals, federated users, service principals, IP addresses, or VPCs that you provide
Description: Checks that the access granted by the Amazon S3 bucket is restricted to any of the AWS principals, federated users, service principals, IP addresses, or VPCs that you provide. The rule is COMPLIANT if a bucket policy is not present.

Name: Checks if an AWS CodeBuild report group has encryption at rest setting enabled
Description: Checks if an AWS CodeBuild report group has encryption at rest setting enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if 'EncryptionDisabled' is 'true'.

Name: Detect whether AWS Systems Manager documents owned by the account are public
Description: Detects whether AWS Systems Manager (SSM) documents owned by the account are public. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any documents with owner 'Self' are public.

Name: Require an Amazon S3 bucket to have versioning enabled
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket has versioning enabled.

Name: Checks if a recovery point was created for Amazon DynamoDB Tables within the specified period
Description: Checks if a recovery point was created for Amazon DynamoDB Tables within the specified period. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the DynamoDB Table does not have a corresponding recovery point created within the specified time period.

Name: Disallow deletion of AWS Config Aggregation Authorizations created by AWS Control Tower
Description: Prevent deletion of AWS Config aggregation authorizations created by AWS Control Tower.

Name: Require an AWS CloudTrail trail to have log file validation activated
Description: This control checks whether log file integrity validation is enabled on an AWS CloudTrail trail.

Name: Checks if S3 buckets have replication rules enabled
Description: Checks if S3 buckets have replication rules enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an S3 bucket does not have a replication rule or has a replication rule that is not enabled.

Name: A WAF Regional rule group should have at least one rule
Description: This control checks whether a WAF Regional rule group has at least one rule. The control fails if no rules are present within a rule group.

Name: Require an Amazon S3 access point to have a Block Public Access (BPA) configuration with all options set to true
Description: This control checks whether an S3 access point has been configured with a Block Public Access (BPA) configuration that has all options set to true.

Name: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to use SNI to serve HTTPS requests
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distributions are configured to use SNI to serve HTTPS requests.

Name: Checks if an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) file system has automatic backups enabled
Description: Checks if an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) file system has automatic backups enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if `BackupPolicy.Status` is set to DISABLED.

Name: Checks if an Amazon Aurora MySQL cluster has backtracking enabled
Description: Checks if an Amazon Aurora MySQL cluster has backtracking enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Aurora cluster uses MySQL and it does not have backtracking enabled.

Name: Require an Amazon Redshift cluster to have a unique database name
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster has changed its database name from the default value.

Name: Require any Amazon ECS cluster to have container insights activated
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon ECS clusters have container insights enabled.

Name: Require an Amazon CloudWatch alarm to have an action configured for the alarm state
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudWatch alarm has at least one action configured for the alarm state.

Name: Checks if Amazon OpenSearch Service version updates are available but not installed
Description: Checks if Amazon OpenSearch Service version updates are available but not installed. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT for an OpenSearch domain if the latest software updates are not installed.

Name: Application Load Balancer deletion protection should be enabled
Description: This control checks whether an Application Load Balancer has deletion protection enabled. The control fails if deletion protection is not configured.

Name: Checks if CloudFront distribution with Amazon S3 Origin type has origin access identity configured
Description: Checks if CloudFront distribution with Amazon S3 Origin type has origin access identity configured. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the CloudFront distribution is backed by S3 and any origin type is not OAI configured, or the origin is not an S3 bucket.

Name: Checks if the deployment group is configured with automatic deployment rollback and deployment monitoring with alarms attached
Description: Checks if the deployment group is configured with automatic deployment rollback and deployment monitoring with alarms attached. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if AutoRollbackConfiguration or AlarmConfiguration has not been configured or is not enabled.

Name: Require an Amazon CloudWatch alarm to have actions activated
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudWatch alarm has actions enabled.

Name: Detect whether replication instances for AWS Database Migration Service are public
Description: Detects whether AWS Database Migration Service replication instances are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the value of the PubliclyAccessible field is set as True.

Name: Elasticsearch domains should be configured with at least three dedicated master nodes
Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured with at least three dedicated master nodes. This control fails if dedicatedMasterEnabled is not true.

Name: EKS clusters should run on a supported Kubernetes version
Description: This control checks whether an EKS cluster is running on a supported Kubernetes version. The control fails if the EKS cluster is running on an unsupported version.

Name: S3 buckets should have lifecycle policies configured
Description: This control checks if a lifecycle policy is configured for an S3 bucket. This control fails if the lifecycle policy is not configured for an S3 bucket.

Name: Disallow configuration changes to AWS Config
Description: Record resource configurations in a consistent manner by ensuring that AWS Config settings don't change.

Name: Checks if Amazon Macie is enabled in your account per region
Description: Checks if Amazon Macie is enabled in your account per region. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the 'status' attribute is not set to 'ENABLED'.

Name: Require any Amazon SQS queue to have a dead-letter queue configured
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon SQS queue is configured with a dead-letter queue.

Name: Require an AWS Lambda function or AWS Lambda function URL to be configured for access only to principals within your AWS account
Description: This control requires an AWS Lambda function resource-based policy to grant access only to IAM principals that reside in your AWS account.

Name: MFA should be enabled for all IAM users that have a console password
Description: This AWS control checks whether AWS Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is enabled for all AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users that use a console password.

Name: Classic Load Balancers with SSL/HTTPS listeners should use a certificate provided by AWS Certificate Manager
Description: This control checks whether a Classic Load Balancer uses HTTPS/SSL certificates provided by AWS Certificate Manager. The control fails if a Classic Load Balancer that is configured with an HTTPS/SSL listener does not use a certificate provided by AWS Certificate Manager.

Name: Require any Amazon CloudFront distributions with Amazon S3 backed origins to have origin access control configured
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distributions backed by Amazon S3 are configured to use an origin access control.

Name: Detect whether encryption is enabled for Amazon EBS volumes attached to Amazon EC2 instances
Description: Detect if the EBS volumes that are attached to an Amazon EC2 instance are encrypted.

Name: Checks if security groups associated with an Amazon Redshift cluster have inbound rules that allow unrestricted incoming traffic
Description: Checks if security groups associated with an Amazon Redshift cluster have inbound rules that allow unrestricted incoming traffic. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are inbound rules that allow unrestricted incoming traffic to the Redshift cluster port.

Name: Require Amazon ECS services not to assign public IP addresses automatically
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon ECS services are configured to assign public IP addresses automatically.

Name: Require an AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) Endpoint to encrypt connections for source and target endpoints
Description: This control checks whether an AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) Endpoint is configured to encrypt connections for source and target endpoints by using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL).

Name: EC2 instances should use Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance metadata version is configured with Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2). The control passes if HttpTokens is set to required for IMDSv2. The control fails if HttpTokens is set to optional.

Name: Network Firewall policies should have at least one rule group associated
Description: This control checks whether a Network Firewall policy has any stateful or stateless rule groups associated. This control fails if stateless or stateful rule groups are not assigned.

Name: Neptune DB clusters should have deletion protection enabled
Description: This control checks whether a Neptune DB cluster has deletion protection enabled. The control fails if a Neptune DB cluster doesn't have deletion protection enabled.

Name: Require an Amazon RDS event notification subscription to have critical database instance events configured
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon RDS event subscriptions for RDS instances are configured to notify on event categories of 'maintenance', 'failure', and 'configuration change'.

Name: Disallow access to the EC2 serial console for all EC2 instances
Description: This control prevents access to the EC2 serial console of all EC2 instances for your account.

Name: Require an Amazon S3 bucket to have server access logging configured
Description: This control checks whether server access logging is enabled for your Amazon S3 bucket.

Name: Require an Amazon S3 bucket to have server-side encryption configured using an AWS KMS key
Description: This control checks whether default server-side encryption is enabled on an Amazon S3 bucket using AWS KMS.

Name: Disallow changes to AWS IAM roles set up by AWS Control Tower and AWS CloudFormation
Description: Prevent changes to AWS IAM roles set up for your accounts by AWS Control Tower and AWS CloudFormation.

Name: Require an Amazon ElastiCache (Redis OSS) replication group to have automatic failover activated
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ElastiCache (Redis OSS) replication group has automatic failover enabled.

Name: Disallow changes to Amazon SNS subscriptions set up by AWS Control Tower
Description: Prevent changes to Amazon SNS subscriptions set up by AWS Control Tower to trigger notifications for AWS Config Rule compliance changes.

Name: RDS automatic minor version upgrades should be enabled
Description: This control checks if automatic minor version upgrades are enabled for the Amazon RDS database instance.

Name: Require any Amazon SQS queue to have encryption at rest configured
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon SQS queue is encrypted at rest.

Name: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to use fine-grained access control
Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains have fine-grained access control enabled.

Name: Checks if Lambda Protection is enabled for an Amazon GuardDuty detector in your account
Description: Checks if Lambda Protection is enabled for an Amazon GuardDuty detector in your account. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Lambda Protection feature in Amazon GuardDuty is not enabled for your account.

Name: Checks if Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) buckets are in a logically air-gapped vault
Description: Checks if Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) buckets are in a logically air-gapped vault. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Amazon S3 bucket is not in a logically air-gapped vault within the specified time period.

Name: Require that an Amazon Elastic MapReduce (EMR) security configuration is configured with EBS volume local disk encryption using an AWS KMS key
Description: This control checks whether Amazon EMR security configurations are configured with local disk encryption enabled, using EBS volume encryption and AWS KMS.

Name: Checks if a Lambda function is configured with a dead-letter queue
Description: Checks if a Lambda function is configured with a dead-letter queue. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Lambda function is not configured with a dead-letter queue.

Name: Checks if Amazon EKS clusters are configured to have Kubernetes secrets encrypted using AWS KMS
Description: Checks if Amazon EKS clusters are configured to have Kubernetes secrets encrypted using AWS KMS. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an EKS cluster does not have an encryptionConfig resource or if encryptionConfig does not name secrets as a resource.

Name: Disallow creation of access keys for the root user
Description: Secure your AWS accounts by disallowing creation of access keys for the root user, which will allow unrestricted access to all resources in the account. We recommend that you instead create access keys for an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user for everyday interaction with your AWS account.

Name: Disallow Changes to Bucket Policy for AWS Control Tower Created S3 Buckets in Log Archive
Description: Protect the integrity of your log archive by ensuring that no bucket policy changes occur to the S3 buckets created by AWS Control Tower.

Name: Checks if AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) endpoints for MongoDb data stores are enabled for password-based authentication and access control
Description: Checks if AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) endpoints for MongoDb data stores are enabled for password-based authentication and access control. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if password-based authentication and access control is not enabled.

Name: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to encrypt data at rest
Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains have encryption-at-rest enabled.

Name: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to have encryption in transit configured
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distributions use HTTPS, either directly or through a redirection.

Name: Disallow changes to Amazon SNS set up by AWS Control Tower
Description: Prevent changes to Amazon SNS notification settings set up by AWS Control Tower.

Name: Security groups should only allow unrestricted incoming traffic for authorized ports
Description: This control checks whether the security groups allow unrestricted incoming traffic. The control fails if ports allow unrestricted traffic on ports other than 80 and 443, which are default values for parameter authorizedTcpPorts.

Name: Detect whether Amazon Redshift clusters are blocked from public access
Description: Detects whether Amazon Redshift clusters are blocked from public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the publiclyAccessible field is true in the cluster configuration item.

Name: Checks if Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) protection is enabled for an Amazon GuardDuty detector in your account
Description: Checks if Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) protection is enabled for an Amazon GuardDuty detector in your account. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Amazon RDS protection feature in Amazon GuardDuty is not enabled for you account.

Name: Require an AWS WAFV2 web ACL to be non-empty
Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAFv2 web ACL contains any WAF rules or WAF rule groups.

Name: IAM customer managed policies that you create should not allow wildcard actions for services
Description: This control checks whether the IAM identity-based custom policies have Allow statements that grant permissions for all actions on a service. The control fails if any policy statement includes "Effect": "Allow" with "Action": "Service:*".

Name: S3 buckets should prohibit public read access
Description: This AWS control checks whether your S3 buckets allow public read access by evaluating the Block Public Access settings, the bucket policy, and the bucket access control list (ACL).

Name: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to have automatic backups configured
Description: This control checks whether Amazon RDS database (DB) instances have automated backups enabled, and verifies that the backup retention period is greater than or equal to seven (7) days.

Name: Require an Amazon RDS database cluster to export logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs by means of the EnableCloudwatchLogsExports property
Description: This control checks whether Amazon RDS database clusters have all available log types configured for export to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

Name: IAM authentication should be configured for RDS clusters
Description: This control checks if an RDS DB cluster has IAM database authentication enabled.

Name: Checks if Amazon GuardDuty has findings that are non-archived
Description: Checks if Amazon GuardDuty has findings that are non-archived. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if GuardDuty has non-archived low/medium/high severity findings older than the specified number in the daysLowSev/daysMediumSev/daysHighSev parameter.

Name: Checks if a server created with AWS Transfer Family uses FTP for endpoint connection
Description: Checks if a server created with AWS Transfer Family uses FTP for endpoint connection. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the server protocol for endpoint connection is FTP-enabled.

Name: Checks if AWS AppConfig applications have tags
Description: Checks if AWS AppConfig applications have tags. Optionally, you can specify tag keys for the rule to check. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no tags or if the specified tag keys are not present. The rule does not check for tags starting with 'aws:'.

Name: Checks if the Amazon FSx for OpenZFS file systems are configured to copy tags to backups and volumes
Description: Checks if the Amazon FSx for OpenZFS file systems are configured to copy tags to backups and volumes. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if FSx for OpenZFS file systems are not configured to copy tags to backups and volumes.

Name: Require all object uploads to Amazon S3 buckets to use server-side encryption with an AWS KMS key (SSE-KMS)
Description: This control prevents object uploads to your Amazon S3 buckets if the request does not include an 'x-amz-server-side-encryption-aws-kms-key-id' header, unless the bucket is configured with default SSE-KMS encryption.

Name: Require Amazon RDS database instances to have AWS IAM authentication configured
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS database (DB) instance has AWS IAM database authentication activated.

Name: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to have a security policy of TLSv1.2 as a minimum
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distributions are using a minimum security policy and cipher suite of TLSv1.2 or greater for viewer connections.

Name: Disallow internet access for an Amazon VPC instance managed by a customer
Description: Disallow internet access for an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) instance managed by a customer, rather than by an AWS service.

Name: SageMaker notebook instances should be launched in a custom VPC
Description: This control checks if an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance is launched within a custom VPC. The control fails if a SageMaker notebook instance is not launched within a custom VPC.

Name: Classic Load Balancer should be configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode
Description: This control checks whether the Classic Load Balancer is configured defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode. This control will fail if the Classic Load Balancer is not configured with defensive strictest mitigation Desync mitigation mode.

Name: Checks if Amazon ElastiCache replication groups have RBAC authentication enabled
Description: Checks if Amazon ElastiCache replication groups have RBAC authentication enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Redis version is 6 or above and ‘UserGroupIds’ is missing, empty, or does not match an entry provided by the 'allowedUserGroupIDs' parameter.

Name: Require any ELB classic load balancer SSL/HTTPS listener to have a predefined security policy with a strong configuration
Description: This control checks whether ELB classic load balancer HTTPS/SSL listeners use the predefined security policy 'ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-2-2017-01'.

Name: Checks if logging is enabled on AWS WAFv2 regional and global web access control lists (web ACLs)
Description: Checks if logging is enabled on AWS WAFv2 regional and global web access control lists (web ACLs). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the logging is enabled but the logging destination does not match the value of the parameter.

Name: Checks if a backup plan has a backup rule that satisfies the required frequency and retention period
Description: Checks if a backup plan has a backup rule that satisfies the required frequency and retention period. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if recovery points are not created at least as often as the specified frequency or expire before the specified period.

Name: Checks if the networking mode for active ECSTaskDefinitions is set to ‘awsvpc’
Description: Checks if the networking mode for active ECSTaskDefinitions is set to ‘awsvpc’. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if active ECSTaskDefinitions is not set to ‘awsvpc’.

Name: Require Amazon API Gateway V2 Websocket and HTTP routes to specify an authorization type
Description: This control checks whether Amazon API Gateway V2 API routes have an authorization type set.

Name: Checks if an Amazon Athena workgroup is encrypted at rest
Description: Checks if an Amazon Athena workgroup is encrypted at rest. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if encryption of data at rest is not enabled for an Athena workgroup.

Name: Require an AWS CloudTrail Lake event data store to enable encryption at rest with an AWS KMS key
Description: This control checks whether a CloudTrail Lake event data store is encrypted at rest with a KMS key.

Name: Require any AWS WAF global rule to have a condition
Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF Classic global rule contains any conditions.

Name: Require an ELB application or classic load balancer to have logging activated
Description: This control checks whether classic load balancers have logging enabled.

Name: Require an Amazon EC2 launch template to have IMDSv2 configured
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon EC2 launch templates are configured with Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2).

Name: Checks if an Amazon MQ broker has CloudWatch audit logging enabled
Description: Checks if an Amazon MQ broker has CloudWatch audit logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the broker does not have audit logging enabled.

Name: Neptune DB clusters should have IAM database authentication enabled
Description: This control checks if a Neptune DB cluster has IAM database authentication enabled. The control fails if IAM database authentication isn't enabled for a Neptune DB cluster.

Name: Require an Amazon RDS DB cluster to have a unique administrator username
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) database (DB) cluster has changed the administrator username from its default value.

Name: Require an Amazon RDS database instance or cluster to have enhanced monitoring configured
Description: This control checks whether enhanced monitoring is activated for Amazon RDS instances.

Name: Checks if an AWS WAF global rule contains any conditions
Description: Checks if an AWS WAF global rule contains any conditions. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no conditions are present within the WAF global rule.

Name: Checks if AWS Backup-Gateway VirtualMachines are protected by a backup plan
Description: Checks if AWS Backup-Gateway VirtualMachines are protected by a backup plan. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Backup-Gateway VirtualMachine is not covered by a backup plan.

Name: Checks if an AWS CodeBuild project environment has privileged mode enabled
Description: Checks if an AWS CodeBuild project environment has privileged mode enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT for a CodeBuild project if ‘privilegedMode’ is set to ‘true’.

Name: Checks if an Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL DB cluster is configured to publish PostgreSQL logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs
Description: Checks if an Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL DB cluster is configured to publish PostgreSQL logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the DB cluster is not configured to publish PostgreSQL logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

Name: Require an Amazon MQ ActiveMQ broker to use use active/standby deployment mode for high availability
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon MQ ActiveMQ broker is configured in an active/standby deployment mode.

Name: Verify that DDoS response team (DRT) can access AWS account
Description: Verify that DDoS response team (DRT) can access AWS account. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if AWS Shield Advanced is enabled but the role for DRT access is not configured.

Name: Detect whether an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain is in Amazon VPC
Description: Detects whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are in Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the OpenSearch Service domain endpoint is public.

Name: A WAF Regional rule should have at least one condition
Description: This control checks whether a WAF Regional rule has at least one condition. The control fails if no conditions are present within a rule.

Name: RDS instances should not use a database engine default port
Description: This control checks whether RDS instances use the default port of that database engine.

Name: Detect whether Amazon EBS snapshots are restorable by all AWS accounts
Description: Detects whether all AWS accounts have access to restore Amazon EBS snapshots. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any snapshots have the RestorableByUserIds field set to the value All. In that case, the Amazon EBS snapshots are public.

Name: Checks if AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) keys are not scheduled for deletion in AWS KMS
Description: Checks if AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) keys are not scheduled for deletion in AWS KMS. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if KMS keys are scheduled for deletion.

Name: Require an Amazon MQ Rabbit MQ broker to use Multi-AZ cluster mode for high availability
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon MQ RabbitMQ broker is configured in a cluster deployment mode, to allow for high availability.

Name: Require an AWS Lambda layer permission to grant access to an AWS organization or specific AWS account
Description: This control checks whether an AWS Lambda layer permission has been configured to grant access to an AWS organization or to a specific AWS account only, by ensuring that public access from all AWS accounts has not been granted to a layer.

Name: Checks if a recovery point was created for Amazon Aurora DB clusters
Description: Checks if a recovery point was created for Amazon Aurora DB clusters. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) DB Cluster does not have a corresponding recovery point created within the specified time period.

Name: Checks if Amazon Aurora MySQL-Compatible Edition clusters are configured to publish audit logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs
Description: Checks if Amazon Aurora MySQL-Compatible Edition clusters are configured to publish audit logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Aurora MySQL-Compatible Edition clusters do not have audit log publishing configured.

Name: S3 Block Public Access setting should be enabled
Description: This AWS control checks whether the following public access block settings are configured from account level: ignorePublicAcls: True, blockPublicPolicy: True, blockPublicAcls: True, restrictPublicBuckets: True.

Name: Checks if all secrets in AWS Secrets Manager are encrypted using an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer master key (CMK)
Description: Checks if all secrets in AWS Secrets Manager are encrypted using an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer master key (CMK). This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a secret is encrypted using the default AWS KMS key

Name: Checks if Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances are protected by a backup plan
Description: Checks if Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances are protected by a backup plan. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Amazon EC2 instance is not covered by a backup plan.

Name: API Gateway REST API stages should have AWS X-Ray tracing enabled
Description: This control checks whether AWS X-Ray active tracing is enabled for your Amazon API Gateway REST API stages.

Name: Require Amazon EC2 launch templates to have Amazon CloudWatch detailed monitoring activated
Description: This control checks whether the Amazon EC2 launch template has detailed monitoring enabled.

Name: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to send audit logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs
Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are configured to send audit logs to an Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group.

Name: ECS task definitions should not share the host's process namespace
Description: This control checks if Amazon ECS task definitions are configured to share a host's process namespace with its containers. This control fails if the task definition shares the host's process namespace with the containers running on it

Name: Access logging should be configured for API Gateway V2 Stages
Description: This control checks if Amazon API Gateway V2 stages have access logging configured. This control fails if access log settings aren’t defined.

Name: Require an Amazon EC2 fleet to override only those launch templates with AWS Nitro instance types
Description: This control checks that Amazon EC2 fleets only override launch templates with AWS Nitro instance types.

Name: Detect whether Amazon EBS volumes are attached to Amazon EC2 instances
Description: Detect when an Amazon EBS volume device is not attached to an Amazon EC2 instance.

Name: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to have origin failover configured
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distribution is configured with an origin group that contains two origin group members.

Name: Require any Amazon EC2 launch template not to auto-assign public IP addresses to network interfaces
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon EC2 launch templates are configured to assign public IP addresses to network interfaces.

Name: Require that Amazon EC2 launch templates restrict the token hop limit to a maximum of one
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 launch template has a metadata token hop limit set to '1'.

Name: Require an Elasticsearch domain to have zone awareness and at least three data nodes
Description: This control checks whether ElasticSearch domains are configured with at least three data nodes and zone awareness enabled.

Name: Checks whether the required public access block settings are configured from account level
Description: Checks whether the required public access block settings are configured from account level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT when the public access block settings are not configured from account level.

Name: Elasticsearch domains should have at least three data nodes
Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured with at least three data nodes and zoneAwarenessEnabled is true.

Name: Secrets Manager secrets should have automatic rotation enabled
Description: This control checks whether a secret stored in AWS Secrets Manager is configured to rotate automatically.

Name: An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical database parameter group events
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS Event subscription for RDS parameter groups is configured to notify on event category of "configuration change".

Name: API Gateway REST API cache data should be encrypted at rest
Description: This control checks whether all methods in Amazon API Gateway REST API stages that have cache enabled are encrypted. The control fails if any method in API Gateway REST API stage is configured to cache and the cache is not encrypted.

Name: Require an Amazon EC2 dedicated host to use an AWS Nitro instance type
Description: This control checks whether an EC2 dedicated host is configured to run using an AWS Nitro instance type or family.

Name: Checks if Capacity Rebalancing is enabled for Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups that use multiple instance types
Description: Checks if Capacity Rebalancing is enabled for Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups that use multiple instance types. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if capacity Rebalancing is not enabled.

Name: Require an Amazon Neptune DB cluster to have deletion protection enabled
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Neptune cluster has deletion protection enabled.

Name: The VPC default security group should not allow inbound and outbound traffic
Description: This AWS control checks that the default security group of a VPC does not allow inbound or outbound traffic.

Name: Require any classic load balancer SSL/HTTPS listener to have a certificate provided by AWS Certificate Manager
Description: This control checks whether classic load balancers use HTTPS/SSL certificates provided by AWS Certificate Manager.

Name: EKS cluster endpoints should not be publicly accessible
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EKS cluster endpoint is publicly accessible. The control fails if an EKS cluster has an endpoint that is publicly accessible.

Name: Require that Amazon EBS direct APIs are not called
Description: This control disallows usage of all EBS direct APIs.

Name: Require AWS Lambda function policies to prohibit public access
Description: This control checks whether an AWS Lambda function resource-based policy prohibits public access.

Name: Require encryption of data in transit for calls to Amazon S3 resources
Description: This control prevents unencrypted connections to Amazon S3 resources in your organization, by using the 'aws:SecureTransport' condition.

Name: Checks if an AWS Glue job has logging enabled
Description: Checks if an AWS Glue job has logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an AWS Glue job does not have Amazon CloudWatch logs enabled.

Name: Checks if AWS App Mesh virtual services have tags
Description: Checks if AWS App Mesh virtual services have tags. Optionally, you can specify tag keys for the rule. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no tags or if the specified tag keys are not present. The rule does not check for tags starting with 'aws:'.

Name: Checks if Amazon Fraud Detector entity types have tags
Description: Checks if Amazon Fraud Detector entity types have tags. Optionally, you can specify tag keys for the rule. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no tags or if the specified tag keys are not present. The rule does not check for tags starting with 'aws:'.

Name: Require an Amazon GuardDuty detector to have Amazon S3 protection activated
Description: This control checks whether Amazon S3 protection is enabled on an Amazon GuardDuty detector.

Name: Checks if an Amazon CloudFront distribution is configured to return a specific object that is the default root object
Description: Checks if an Amazon CloudFront distribution is configured to return a specific object that is the default root object. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Amazon CloudFront distribution does not have a default root object configured.

Name: Checks if Amazon Inspector V2 Lambda code scanning is activated for your single or multi-account environment to detect potential code vulnerabilities
Description: Checks if Amazon Inspector V2 Lambda code scanning is activated for your single or multi-account environment to detect potential code vulnerabilities. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Lambda code scanning is not activated.

Name: Require that an AWS KMS key is configured with the bypass policy lockout safety check enabled
Description: This control disallows bypassing the KMS key policy lockout safety check when creating a KMS key or updating its key policy.

Name: OpenSearch domains should have audit logging enabled
Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains have audit logging enabled.

Name: Require Amazon ECR private repositories to have tag immutability enabled
Description: This control checks whether a private Amazon ECR repository has tag immutability enabled.

Name: Require an Amazon RDS DB Proxy to require Transport Layer Security (TLS) connections
Description: This control checks whether an RDS DB Proxy is configured to require Transport Layer Security (TLS) for connections to the proxy.

Name: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to copy tags to snapshots
Description: This control checks whether Amazon RDS DB instances are configured to copy all tags to snapshots created.

Name: Checks if the inline policy feature is not in use
Description: Checks if the inline policy feature is not in use. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user, IAM role or IAM group has any inline policy.

Name: Require any classic load balancer to have multiple Availability Zones configured
Description: This control checks whether an ELB classic load balancer has been configured with multiple Availability Zones.

Name: Detect whether Amazon S3 settings to block public access are set as true for the account
Description: Periodically detects whether the required Amazon S3 settings to block public access are configured as true for the account, rather than for a bucket or an access point.

Name: Require that AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) customer-managed policies do not have wildcard service actions
Description: This control checks that AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) customer-managed policies do not contain statements of "Effect": "Allow" with "Action": "Service:*" (for example, s3:*) for individual AWS services, and that the policies do not use the combination of "NotAction" with an "Effect" of "Allow".

Name: Auto Scaling groups should use multiple instance types in multiple Availability Zones
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group uses multiple instance types. This control fails if the Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group has only one instance type defined.

Name: Detect whether unrestricted incoming TCP traffic is allowed
Description: Reduce a server's exposure to risk by detecting whether unrestricted incoming TCP traffic is allowed.

Name: S3 buckets should require requests to use Secure Socket Layer
Description: This AWS control checks whether S3 buckets have policies that require requests to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL).

Name: Require an AWS KMS key policy to have a statement that limits creation of AWS KMS grants to AWS services
Description: This control requires that KMS grants are issued only to AWS services that are integrated with AWS KMS, or to an AWS service principal.

Name: Require an Amazon Redshift cluster to have automatic snapshots configured
Description: This control checks whether Amazon Redshift clusters have automated snapshots enabled, and set with an automated snapshot retention period greater than or equal to seven (7) days.

Name: Checks if an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) mount target is not associated with a public subnet
Description: Checks if an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) mount target is not associated with a public subnet. The rule is NON-COMPLIANT if the Amazon EFS mount target is associated with a public subnet.

Name: RDS DB instances should be configured with multiple Availability Zones
Description: This control checks whether high availability is enabled for your RDS DB instances.

Name: Checks if AWS App Mesh meshes have tags
Description: Checks if AWS App Mesh meshes have tags. Optionally, you can specify tag keys for the rule to check. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no tags or if the specified tag keys are not present. The rule does not check for tags starting with 'aws:'.

Name: Checks if AWS Elastic Beanstalk environments are configured to send logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs
Description: Checks if AWS Elastic Beanstalk environments are configured to send logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the value of `StreamLogs` is false.

Name: ECR private repositories should have tag immutability configured
Description: This control checks whether a private ECR repository has tag immutability configured. This control fails if a private ECR repository has tag immutability disabled. This rule passes if tag immutability is configured and has the value IMMUTABLE

Name: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to use a minimum TLS version of TLSv1.2
Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are configured to require HTTPS with a minimum TLS version of TLSv1.2.

Name: ElastiCache replication groups of earlier Redis versions should have Redis AUTH enabled
Description: This control checks if ElastiCache replication groups have Redis AUTH enabled. The control fails for an ElastiCache replication group if the Redis version of its nodes is below 6 and 'AuthToken' is not in use.

Name: Require any AWS WAF global web ACL to have a rule or rule group
Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF Classic global web ACL contains any WAF rules or rule groups.

Name: Require any Amazon Kinesis data stream to have encryption at rest configured
Description: This control checks whether Amazon Kinesis data streams are encrypted at rest with server-side encryption.

Name: Require an Amazon EC2 instance to use an AWS Nitro instance type when creating from the 'AWS::EC2::LaunchTemplate' resource type
Description: This control checks whether Amazon EC2 launch templates that specify an EC2 instance type or use attribute based instance selection, specify only AWS Nitro instance types.

Name: Checks if Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) logging is enabled for the delivery status of notification messages sent to a topic for the endpoints
Description: Checks if Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) logging is enabled for the delivery status of notification messages sent to a topic for the endpoints. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the delivery status notification for messages is not enabled.

Name: Checks if the first deployment stage of AWS CodePipeline performs more than one deployment
Description: Checks if the first deployment stage of AWS CodePipeline performs more than one deployment. Optionally checks if each of the subsequent remaining stages deploy to more than the specified number of deployments (deploymentLimit).

Name: Require that application load balancer deletion protection is activated
Description: Checks whether an Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) has deletion protection activated.

Name: Checks if the S3 bucket has lock enabled, by default
Description: Checks if the S3 bucket has lock enabled, by default. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the lock is not enabled.

Name: Detect whether public read access to Amazon S3 buckets is allowed
Description: Secure access to data stored in Amazon S3 buckets by detecting whether public read access is allowed.

Name: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to have a default root object configured
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudFront distribution is configured to return a specific object that is the default root object.

Name: Disallow the use of Amazon EC2 VM import and export
Description: This control disallows use of EC2 VM Import/Export APIs that can be used to import and export EC2 instance, snapshot, image and volume data.

Name: The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a security configuration is not attached to the cluster or the security configuration does not satisfy the specified rule parameters
Description: The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a security configuration is not attached to the cluster or the security configuration does not satisfy the specified rule parameters.

Name: Require an Amazon RDS database cluster to have backtracking configured
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) database (DB) cluster has backtracking enabled.

Name: Require that an Amazon Elastic MapReduce (EMR) security configuration is configured to encrypt data in transit
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EMR security configuration is configured to require encryption in transit.

Name: Checks if Amazon FSx File Systems are protected by a backup plan
Description: Checks if Amazon FSx File Systems are protected by a backup plan. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Amazon FSx File System is not covered by a backup plan.

Name: Checks if the S3 bucket configurations for your AWS CloudTrail logs block public access
Description: Checks if the S3 bucket configurations for your AWS CloudTrail logs block public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if at least one S3 bucket for a CloudTrail trail is publicly accessible.

Name: Require Amazon SageMaker notebook instances to have root access disallowed
Description: This control checks whether Amazon SageMaker notebook instances allow root access.

Name: Checks if the SNS topic access policy allows public access
Description: Checks if the SNS topic access policy allows public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the SNS topic access policy allows public access.

Name: CodeBuild GitHub or Bitbucket source repository URLs should use OAuth
Description: This AWS control checks whether the GitHub or Bitbucket source repository URL contains either personal access tokens or user name and password.

Name: OpenSearch domain error logging to CloudWatch Logs should be enabled
Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch domains are configured to send error logs to CloudWatch Logs. This control fails if error logging to CloudWatch is not enabled for a domain.

Name: Require an AWS WAFV2 rule group to be non-empty
Description: This control checks whether AWS WAFV2 rule groups contain rules.

Name: Detect public write access setting for log archive
Description: Detect public write access setting for Amazon S3 buckets created by AWS Control Tower in the log archive account.

Name: Require an Amazon EKS cluster to be configured with secret encryption using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) keys
Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) clusters are configured to use Kubernetes secrets encrypted with AWS Key Management Service (KMS) keys.

Name: EC2 Auto Scaling groups should use EC2 launch templates
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group is created from an EC2 launch template. This control fails if an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group is not created with a launch template or if a launch template is not specified in a mixed instances policy.

Name: Disallow policy changes to log archive
Description: Protect the integrity of your log archive by ensuring no policy changes happen to the S3 bucket by any user.

Name: Checks if there are any Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) DB security groups that are not the default DB security group
Description: Checks if there are any Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) DB security groups that are not the default DB security group. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT is there are any DB security groups that are not the default DB security group.

Name: EC2 instances managed by Systems Manager should have an association compliance status of COMPLIANT
Description: This AWS control checks whether the status of the AWS Systems Manager association compliance is COMPLIANT or NON_COMPLIANT after the association is executed on an instance.

Name: Checks if Amazon Inspector V2 EC2 scanning is activated for your single or multi-account environment to detect potential vulnerabilities and network reachability issues on your EC2 instances
Description: Checks if Amazon Inspector V2 EC2 scanning is activated for your single or multi-account environment to detect potential vulnerabilities and network reachability issues on your EC2 instances. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if EC2 scanning is not activated.

Name: Disallow changes to AWS Lambda functions set up by AWS Control Tower
Description: Prevent changes to AWS Lambda functions set up by AWS Control Tower.

Name: Require any application load balancer listener default actions to redirect all HTTP requests to HTTPS
Description: This control checks whether HTTP to HTTPS redirection is configured as a default action on HTTP listeners of application load balancers.

Name: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to use custom SSL/TLS certificates
Description: This control checks whether the certificate associated with an Amazon CloudFront distribution is a custom SSL/TLS certificate.

Name: Checks if a recovery point was created for Amazon FSx File Systems
Description: Checks if a recovery point was created for Amazon FSx File Systems. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Amazon FSx File System does not have a corresponding recovery point created within the specified time period.

Name: ECS clusters should use Container Insights
Description: This control checks if ECS clusters use Container Insights. This control fails if Container Insights are not set up for a cluster.

Name: Checks if connections to Amazon RDS for MySQL database instances are configured to use encryption in transit
Description: Checks if connections to Amazon RDS for MySQL database instances are configured to use encryption in transit. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the associated database parameter group is not in-sync or if the require_secure_transport parameter is not set to 1.

Name: Checks if an origin group is configured for the distribution of at least two origins in the origin group for Amazon CloudFront
Description: Checks if an origin group is configured for the distribution of at least two origins in the origin group for Amazon CloudFront. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no origin groups for the distribution.

Name: Checks if an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key is configured for an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance
Description: Checks if an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key is configured for an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if 'KmsKeyId' is not specified for the SageMaker notebook instance.

Name: Require that an AWS ELB application or classic load balancer listener is configured with HTTPS or TLS termination
Description: This control checks whether your AWS Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) classic load balancer front-end listeners are configured with HTTPS or SSL protocols.

Name: Checks if an AWS CloudTrail multi-Region trail is enabled and logs all write S3 data events for your buckets
Description: Checks if an AWS CloudTrail multi-Region trail is enabled and logs all write S3 data events for your buckets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no multi-Region trail logs all write S3 data event types for all current and future S3 buckets.

Name: Disallow actions as a root user
Description: Secure your AWS accounts by disallowing account access with root user credentials, which are credentials of the account owner and allow unrestricted access to all resources in the account. We recommend that you instead create AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users for everyday interaction with your AWS account.

Name: Detect whether MFA for the root user is enabled
Description: Detect whether root user has Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) enabled, MFA requires an additional authentication code after the user name and password are successful.

Name: Checks if your Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) cluster has ClusterEndpointEncryptionType set to TLS
Description: Checks if your Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) cluster has ClusterEndpointEncryptionType set to TLS. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a DAX cluster is not encrypted by transport layer security (TLS).

Name: Require an AWS Network Firewall firewall to be deployed across multiple Availability Zones
Description: This control checks whether an AWS Network Firewall firewall is deployed across multiple Availability Zones (AZs), to permit automatic failover between AZs.

Name: Require an Amazon EFS file system to encrypt file data at rest using AWS KMS
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EFS file system is configured to encrypt file data using AWS KMS.

Name: Checks if AWS IoT SiteWise asset models have tags
Description: Checks if AWS IoT SiteWise asset models have tags. Optionally, you can specify tag keys for the rule. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no tags or if the specified tag keys are not present. The rule does not check for tags starting with 'aws:'.

Name: Require any AWS WAF regional web access control list (ACL) to have a rule or rule group
Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF Classic regional web ACL contains any WAF rules or rule groups.

Name: Require an Amazon Redshift cluster to be encrypted
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster is encrypted.

Name: Checks if AWS IAM SSL/TLS server certificates stored in IAM are expired
Description: Checks if AWS IAM SSL/TLS server certificates stored in IAM are expired. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an IAM server certificate is expired.

Name: Require an Amazon EBS volume configured through an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling launch configuration to encrypt data at rest
Description: This control checks whether Auto Scaling launch configurations with Amazon EBS volume block device mappings enable EBS volume encryption.

Name: Checks if logging is enabled with a valid severity level for AWS DMS replication tasks of a source database
Description: Checks if logging is enabled with a valid severity level for AWS DMS replication tasks of a source database. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled or logs for DMS replication tasks of a source database have a severity level that is not valid.

Name: RDS DB clusters should be encrypted at rest
Description: This control checks whether an RDS DB cluster is encrypted at rest. The control fails if an RDS DB cluster isn't encrypted at rest.

Name: Checks if an Amazon DynamoDB table have deletion protection set to enabled
Description: Checks if an Amazon DynamoDB table have deletion protection set to enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the table have deletion protection set to disabled.

Name: Detect whether an Amazon EKS endpoint is blocked from public access
Description: Detects whether an Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) endpoint is publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the endpoint is publicly accessible.

Name: Checks whether Amazon DynamoDB table is encrypted with AWS Key Management Service (KMS)
Description: Checks whether Amazon DynamoDB table is encrypted with AWS Key Management Service (KMS). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Amazon DynamoDB table is not encrypted with AWS KMS.

Name: IAM customer managed policies should not allow decryption actions on all KMS keys
Description: Checks whether the default version of IAM customer managed policies allow principals to use the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) decryption actions on all resources. This control fails if kms:Decrypt or kms:ReEncryptFrom actions are allowed on all KMS keys. The control evaluates both attached and unattached customer managed policies. It does not check inline policies or AWS managed policies.

Name: Checks if AWS App Mesh gateway routes have tags
Description: Checks if AWS App Mesh gateway routes have tags. Optionally, you can specify tag keys for the rule. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no tags or if the specified tag keys are not present. The rule does not check for tags starting with 'aws:'.

Name: Require Amazon ECS containers to allow read-only access to the root filesystem
Description: This control checks whether Amazon ECS task definitions have been configured to require read-only access to container root filesystems.

Name: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to encrypt traffic to custom origins
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distributions are encrypting traffic to custom origins.

Name: Disallow modification of an AWS Backup resource that AWS Control Tower manages
Description: This control limits creation or modification of AWS Backup resources that AWS Control Tower manages.

Name: Require that an Amazon RDS database instance is configured with multiple Availability Zones
Description: This control checks whether high availability is configured for your Amazon RDS database instances.

Name: Checks if Amazon S3 access points have block public access settings enabled
Description: Checks if Amazon S3 access points have block public access settings enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if block public access settings are not enabled for S3 access points.

Name: Require an AWS Glue job to have an associated security configuration
Description: This control checks whether an AWS Glue job has an associated security configuration.

Name: Checks if Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances are in a logically air-gapped vault
Description: Checks if Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances are in a logically air-gapped vault. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Amazon EC2 instance is not in a logically air-gapped vault within the specified time period.

Name: Require that AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) customer-managed policies do not contain a statement that includes "*" in the Action and Resource elements
Description: This control checks whether AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) customer managed policies do not include "Effect": "Allow" with "Action": "*" over "Resource": "*".

Name: Classic Load Balancer listeners should be configured with HTTPS or TLS termination
Description: This control checks whether your Classic Load Balancer listeners are configured with HTTPS or TLS protocol for front-end (client to load balancer) connections. The control is applicable if a Classic Load Balancer has listeners. If your Classic Load Balancer does not have a listener configured, then the control does not report any findings.

Name: Deny access to AWS based on the requested AWS Region for an organizational unit
Description: Disallows access to unlisted operations in global and regional services outside of the specified Regions for an organizational unit.

Name: Checks if Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are configured with at least three dedicated primary nodes
Description: Checks if Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are configured with at least three dedicated primary nodes. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT for an OpenSearch Service domain if 'DedicatedMasterEnabled' is set to 'false', or 'DedicatedMasterCount' is less than 3.

Name: Require that any application load balancer must be configured to drop HTTP headers
Description: This control checks whether application load balancers are configured to drop non-valid HTTP headers.

Name: RDS DB instances should publish logs to CloudWatch Logs
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS DB instance is configured to publish the following logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. The control fails if the instance isn’t configured to publish the following logs to CloudWatch Logs: Oracle: (Alert, Audit, Trace, Listener), PostgreSQL: (Postgresql, Upgrade), MySQL: (Audit, Error, General, SlowQuery), MariaDB: (Audit, Error, General, SlowQuery), SQL Server: (Error, Agent), Aurora: (Audit, Error, General, SlowQuery), Aurora-MySQL: (Audit, Error, General, SlowQuery), Aurora-PostgreSQL: (Postgresql).

Name: Checks if an Amazon DynamoDB table is present in AWS Backup plans
Description: Checks if an Amazon DynamoDB table is present in AWS Backup plans. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if DynamoDB tables are not present in any AWS Backup plan.

Name: Disallow changes to AWS Config Rules set up by AWS Control Tower
Description: Prevent changes to AWS Config Rules set up by AWS Control Tower.

Name: Require an Amazon RDS database instance not to use a database engine default port
Description: This control checks whether Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) database instances are configured for default database port for their specific engine types.

Name: Require an Amazon API Gateway REST API stage to have AWS X-Ray tracing activated
Description: This control ensures that AWS X-Ray tracing is enabled on Amazon API Gateway REST APIs.

Name: ActiveMQ brokers should use active/standby deployment mode
Description: This control checks whether the deployment mode for an Amazon MQ ActiveMQ broker is set to active/standby. The control fails if a single-instance broker (enabled by default) is set as the deployment mode.

Name: Checks if at least one AWS CloudTrail trail is logging Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) data events for all S3 buckets
Description: Checks if at least one AWS CloudTrail trail is logging Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) data events for all S3 buckets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are trails or if no trails record S3 data events.

Name: Enhanced monitoring should be configured for RDS DB instances
Description: This control checks whether enhanced monitoring is enabled for your RDS DB instances.

Name: Application Load Balancer should be configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode
Description: This control checks whether the Application Load Balancer is configured with defensive or strictest de-sync mitigation mode. This control fails if the Application Load Balancer is not configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode.

Name: Checks if an AWS Glue ML Transform has encryption at rest enabled
Description: Checks if an AWS Glue ML Transform has encryption at rest enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if `MLUserDataEncryptionMode` is set to `DISABLED`.

Name: Require that the organization's Amazon S3 resources are accessible only by IAM principals that belong to the organization or by an AWS service
Description: This control disallows Amazon S3 API operations for your organization's Amazon S3 resources by an AWS IAM principal when the principal is outside of the organization and is not an AWS service principal.

Name: Require an AWS Lambda function URL to use AWS IAM-based authentication
Description: This control checks whether an AWS Lambda function URL is configured to use authentication that's based on AWS IAM.

Name: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to not be publicly accessible
Description: This rule checks whether Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) database (DB) instances are publicly accessible, as determined by checking the 'PubliclyAccessible' configuration property.

Name: Require an Amazon ElastiCache cache cluster to use a custom subnet group
Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ElastiCache cache cluster is configured with a custom subnet group.

Name: Require OAuth on GitHub or Bitbucket source repository URLs for AWS CodeBuild projects
Description: This control checks whether the GitHub or Bitbucket source repository URL contains either personal access tokens or a username and password.

Name: RDS DB instances should be configured to copy tags to snapshots
Description: This control checks whether RDS DB instances are configured to copy all tags to snapshots when the snapshots are created.

Name: Require an Amazon RDS event subscription to have critical cluster events configured
Description: This control checks whether your Amazon RDS event subscriptions for RDS clusters are configured to notify on event categories of 'maintenance' and 'failure.'
